@shimulshah73 @PaulKaranicolas @HalaMuaddi @OHSUNews @OHSUKnight In our data less than 50% of patients with biliary sclerosis need a stent (take FUDR out of pump, fill with dex, start ursodiol) and can usually quickly get back on systemic therapy; this had no influence on survival similar to reports from MSK and others.

@drymtn @PaulKaranicolas @HalaMuaddi @OHSUNews @OHSUKnight Congrats.  What happened with the biliary sclerosis?  Issues or manageable?  Also interesting some patients only got 1 cycle of systemic before HAIP?

@KevinKrooss @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews That‚Äôs one example of addiction causing mental illness.  There are examples of mental illnesses making addiction more likely. Like I said, it goes both ways... Depending on the person

@KevinKrooss @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews I know it caused my addiction, and it is documented that people with my affliction are nearly 3 times more likely to have a SUD.  So for me, being misdiagnosed was devastating and there is no skepticism.

@thebestsmr @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews ‚ÄúKorsakoff syndrome is a chronic memory disorder caused by severe deficiency of thiamine (vitamin B-1). Korsakoff syndrome is most commonly caused by alcohol misuse...‚Äù

@KevinKrooss @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews That‚Äôs not what you said, you said that you didn‚Äôt buy the idea that mental illness could cause addiction. That‚Äôs what I vehemently disagree with... now if you believe that it can go either way, than you and I are on the same page.
RT @NPRCnews: Alcoholism can affect health, relationships and livelihoods. New evidence from @OHSUNews #ONPRC is shedding light on this com‚Ä¶

@thebestsmr @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews I expressed MY own observations over the last 32+ years. You threw your situation into the discussion. You assumed I was talking about you personally. I‚Äôm not. I was only saying alcoholism/mental health issues may be a chicken or the egg situation, as to which causes the other.

@KevinKrooss @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews You come on here and act like I don't know wtf I am talking about in relation to my situation by saying you don't "buy" what happened to me. It's your narrow-minded attitude that prevents other people from exploring all options when trying to recover.
@thebestsmr @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews I don‚Äôt want to either.

@KevinKrooss @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews Substance Use Disorder is a documented mental illness. And don‚Äôt tell me about my struggles because I can ensure you, you don‚Äôt know anything about them.
@pondbear119 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews I don‚Äôt recall ever reading that in their writings.

@thebestsmr @TerriAWilliams1 @NPRCnews @OHSUNews I also have never been diagnosed with any mental issues. Sober almost 33 years now. 

I‚Äôm a bit skeptical of the ‚Äúself-medicating with drugs and alcohol‚Äù theory. I think it might be the other way around. Drug and alcohol abuse creates mental illness.
